org.sd.text
Class WordGramStats

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.WordGramStats

public class WordGramStats
extends java.lang.Object

Container for aggretating stats for word N-grams (from lowN to highN).

Author:
Spence Koehler

WordGramStats

public WordGramStats(int n)
Construct an instance for reconstruction.

NOTE: The add(string) and flush methods will be disabled and only the add(NGramFreq) and getter methods will work.

Returns:
the alternate WordGramStat instances, possibly null.

add

public void add(java.lang.String string)
Collect n-grams from the given string.

The idea is to add strings that are split into N-grams that are collected but not analyzed for statistics. Once all strings have been added, then a "flush" will add the collected N-grams to the statistical tallies.

The consumer can manually flush after every add for tallies on every string or flush after certain groups of strings have been added so that within the group, duplicates are not tallied, but across groups they are.

wasPruned

public boolean wasPruned()
Determine whether the underlying stats were pruned while adding.

flush

public void flush(java.lang.String source)
Flush added N-grams through stat aggregation since the last flush, identifying the source (ok if null).

add

public void add(NGramFreq nGramFreq)
Add the nGramFreq to a reconstruction instance.

pruneOverlap

public void pruneOverlap()
Prune lower-N ngrams that are contained (as full words) within higher-N-ngrams at the same frequency.

Note that this only prunes those that have already been flushed and that later flushes will need to be "re-pruned".

findWordGram

public int[] findWordGram(java.lang.String wordGram,
                          int n,
                          java.lang.String text)
Find the (first intance of the normalized) wordGram in the (original) text.

Parameters:
wordGram - The word N-gram text to find.
n - The N-gram's 'N' (number of words in wordGram).
text - The original text in which to locate the wordGram.
Returns:
the first [start, end) position of the word N-gram in text, or null if not found.

getNgram2Freq

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NGramFreq> getNgram2Freq(int n)
Get the raw n-gram to frequency map.

Parameters:
n - Is the "n" in n-gram in the range of lowN to highN.

getTopNGramsLimitedByCount

public NGramFreq[] getTopNGramsLimitedByCount(int n,
                                              int num,
                                              java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean die)
Get the top 'num' n-grams.

Parameters:
n - Is the "n" in n-gram in the range of lowN to highN.
num - Is the (maximum) number of n-grams to collect.
die - Flag to monitor for a signal to terminate early.

getTopNGramsLimitedByFreq

public NGramFreq[] getTopNGramsLimitedByFreq(int n,
                                             int minFreq,
                                             java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean die)
Get the top n-grams w/freq greater than or equal to minFreq.

Parameters:
n - Is the "n" in n-gram in the range of lowN to highN.
minFreq - Is the (minimum) frequency of an n-gram to collect.
die - Flag to monitor for a signal to terminate early.
